definition: surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: President George Bush has had many insults hurled at him during his time in office.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統在其任內已經遭到過很多的辱罵了。

sentences.english: The upcoming visit will be second visit of Premier Wen to Germany since he took office.
sentences.chinese: 此訪是溫總理任內第二次訪德。

sentences.english: Here is a comment on the achievements during his tenure of Liang Jiang Provincial Governor.
sentences.chinese: 本文僅就其在兩江總督任內的政績作評述。

sentences.english: But the progress of the campaign Nickels started has continued under the new mayor.
sentences.chinese: 可是尼克爾斯開展的活動卻延續到新市長任內。

sentences.english: In Palmisano's tenure, IBM has bought more than 30% of its shares.
sentences.chinese: 彭明盛任內，IBM累計買回了超過30%的股票。

sentences.english: The Governor General welcomed Ambassador Zhang as the new Chinese Ambassador to Canada and wished him all the best in his tenure.
sentences.chinese: 約翰斯頓總督歡迎章大使履新，預祝他任內工作順利。

sentences.english: This news has also been regarded as the greatest diplomatic achievement for the Ma Government term.
sentences.chinese: 這個消息也被視爲馬政府任內最大外交政績。

sentences.english: On Bush's watch the country was flooded with cocaine form the Medellin cartel.
sentences.chinese: 在布什任內，美國充斥來自麥德林犯罪組織的可卡因。

definition: to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
to take part in an election/to run for office
Taiwanese variant of 奧巴馬|奥巴马[Ao4 ba1 ma3], Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
Tung Chee-hwa (1937-), Hong Kong entrepreneur and politician, chief executive 1997-2005
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
